  • Sign In

  1. About Bethlehem
  2. Town Government

  4. Doing Business
  5. How Do I?
  1. Featured News
  1. Featured News

  1. Bethlehem Youth Court's 2018 Annual Report is Available

    Bethlehem Youth Court is a non-profit diversion program for youth in the Town of Bethlehem. Each year the program puts together an annual report for review by the Town Board. It was presented during the 3/27 meeting and is available for public viewing. Read on...

  2. The Court office will be closed for training on 4/25/19.

    The Court office will be closed for training on 4/25/19. Read on...

  3. Residential Data Improvement Project - letters have been sent to owners regarding next areas

    Letters from GAR Associates (data collectors) have gone out to residents for year 3 and 4 of our Residential Data Improvement Project; this includes, Glenmont, Selkirk, South Bethlehem, and Feura Bush areas. Read on...

  4. Public Information Meeting to Present Estimates for Rail Trail Bridge

    Albany County has scheduled the first public information meeting to present cost estimates for the rehabilitation and replacement alternatives for the Rail Trail Bridge over New Scotland Rd at the Slingerlands Fire Department on Wednesday, May 1 at 6 p.m. Read on...

  5. Spring Water Main Flushing Program - 4/1 to 5/17

    Some discoloration may be seen during this flushing program, run water until it clears before doing laundry. 4/1 to 4/19: Slingerlands, North Bethlehem, Town of New Scotland 4/10 to 5/10: Delmar, Elsmere 4/24 to 5/17: Glenmont, Selkirk Read on...

  6. Parking Ordinance - No parking on town roads 1-7 am from 11/1 to 4/15

    The town has a parking ordinance in effect each year from November 1 through April 15 whereby no vehicles are allowed to be parked on any town roads between the hours of 1:00 a.m. to 7:00 a.m. regardless of the weather. Read on...

  7. Avoid Bear Conflict and Deer in Spring Information

    The Town's Animal Control officer received a newsletter from the NYS DEC containing information he would like shared with residents and businesses regarding bear and deer both of which are seen in many areas of town. Follow precautions noted. Read on...

  8. Know What´s Below Before You Dig, call for FREE underground utilities markings, it's the law

    Planning a home improvement job? Planting a tree? Installing a fence or deck? WAIT! Here´s what you need to know first. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx

  1. Featured News

  1. Helderberg to Hudson Half Marathon is taking place this Saturday, could cause intermittent delays

    The Helderberg to Hudson Half Marathon is taking place this Saturday starting at 8 am. 2,500+ participants are registered to run through town on the Rail Trail. There could be intermittent delays at the Hudson/Adams and the Font Grove Rd crossings. Read on...

  2. Bethlehem Youth Court's 2018 Annual Report is Available

    Bethlehem Youth Court is a non-profit diversion program for youth in the Town of Bethlehem. Each year the program puts together an annual report for review by the Town Board. It was presented during the 3/27 meeting and is available for public viewing. Read on...

  3. The Court office will be closed for training on 4/25/19.

    The Court office will be closed for training on 4/25/19. Read on...

  4. Residential Data Improvement Project - letters have been sent to owners regarding next areas

    Letters from GAR Associates (data collectors) have gone out to residents for year 3 and 4 of our Residential Data Improvement Project; this includes, Glenmont, Selkirk, South Bethlehem, and Feura Bush areas. Read on...

  5. Public Information Meeting to Present Estimates for Rail Trail Bridge

    Albany County has scheduled the first public information meeting to present cost estimates for the rehabilitation and replacement alternatives for the Rail Trail Bridge over New Scotland Rd at the Slingerlands Fire Department on Wednesday, May 1 at 6 p.m. Read on...

  6. Evacuation Functional Needs 911 Registry Available

    The BPD in partnership with the Albany County Sheriff's Office encourages all residents with special needs to register with the Countywide Registry for Persons In Need - for those who would need help to evacuate during an emergency situation. Read on...

  7. Spring Water Main Flushing Program - 4/1 to 5/17

    Some discoloration may be seen during this flushing program, run water until it clears before doing laundry. 4/1 to 4/19: Slingerlands, North Bethlehem, Town of New Scotland 4/10 to 5/10: Delmar, Elsmere 4/24 to 5/17: Glenmont, Selkirk Read on...

  8. Parking Ordinance - No parking on town roads 1-7 am from 11/1 to 4/15

    The town has a parking ordinance in effect each year from November 1 through April 15 whereby no vehicles are allowed to be parked on any town roads between the hours of 1:00 a.m. to 7:00 a.m. regardless of the weather. Read on...
